abstract: “When I was growing up, I never thought of myself as Greek. My family has been in the United States since the 1800s,” said Peter C. Georgiopoulos, chief executive, General Maritime.
snippet: “When I was growing up, I never thought of myself as Greek. My family has been in the United States since the 1800s,” said Peter C. Georgiopoulos, chief executive, General Maritime.
lead_paragraph: I’VE had people ask me whether, had one of my ancestors shortened the name from Georgiopoulos to something like George, I would have wound up in the traditional role of Greek shipping magnate. A better question might be, if I hadn’t grown up in the United States, where everything seems possible, would I have even tried?

byline.original: As told to Claudia H. Deutsch
